Subject: Re: Freely Propagating Flame Example in Matlab
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=223718516; y=hIn17MD55u9OJyHDXkVGhDDVnoLkLAf4MaMCer93NgDtFo91h4l94BT0kA

I have been looking to create a Matlab model of a freely propagating
flame.=
 The python example free_h2_air.py uses FreeFlame.py. I have
started out by=
 first comparing the provided demos Flame1.m and
flame1.py in an attempt to=
 understand the differences between the
simulations in Matlab and Python. I=
 have also been looking through the
tutorial files provided with Cantera fo=
r both Matlab and Python.

I believe that the following statement in the py=
thon file flame1.py

f =3D BurnerFlame(gas =3D gas, grid =3D inital_grid)

=
is equivalent to the series of statements found throughout the Matlab
file =
Flame1.m

1)  f =3D AxisymmetricFlow(gas, 'flow');
2)  set(f, 'P', p, 'grid=
', inital_grid);
3)  burner =3D Inlet(`burner');
4)  s =3D Outlet(`out');
5=
)  f1 =3D flame(gas, burner, f, s);
6)  setMaxJacAge(f1, max_jacobian_age(1=
), max_jacobian_age(2));

From there I went and compared the Pyhton files B=
urnerFlame.py to
FreeFlame.py in order to see what is unique about the Free=
Flame
simulation and I concluded the following.

FreeFlame.py introduces a =
few extra statements when compared to
BurnerFlame.py See the list below.

7=
) from Cantera import _cantera
8) self.tfix =3D tfix
9) self.setFixedTemper=
ature(self.tfix)
10) def setFixedTemperature(self, temp)
11) _cantera.sim1D=
_setFixedTemperature(self._hndl, temp)

FreeFlame.py also modifies the foll=
owing statements from BurnerFlame.py

12) def _init_(self, gas =3D None, gr=
id =3D None, tfix =3D 500.0): 
in this statement burner =3D None and outlet=
 =3D None is removed while
tfix is added
13) self.flame =3D AxisymmetricFlo=
w(`flame', gas =3D gas, type=3D2)
the difference with this statement was th=
at type=3D2 was added
14) z1 =3D 0.5 is changed from 0.2
15) locs =3D array=
([0.0, 0.3, z1, 1.0], `d') the entry 0.3 is added to
the array
16) self.set=
Profile(`u', locs, [u0, u0, u1, u1]) a second u0 is added
17) self.setProfi=
le(`T', locs, [t0, t0, teq, teq]) a second u0 is added
18) self.setProfile(=
gas.speciesName(n), locs, [yin[n], yin[n], yeq[n],
yeq[n]) a second yin[n] =
is added.

From this point I was looking to build the model of free_h2_air.=
py in
Matlab. I order to do this it looks as if I will need to

- use the M=
atlab code in points 1 to 6 and modify it to add in the
effects of the poin=
ts 7 to 18 which was used in the python code.

A few questions

- How do yo=
u implement the tfix variable?
- What does type=3D2 mean for AxisymmetricFl=
ow?
- Why is Z1 changed to .5?
- Why is locs array modified to have 4 entri=
es which in turn
introduces a second u0, t0 and yin[n] (points 15 to 18 abo=
ve)?

Does anyone have any suggestions to help me understand how to do this=

or can help explain this to me?

Thank you in advance.

Chris Kelly


--- =

ions with this example via matlab if possible.

lly
